summary: The document is an outside contact report from the HSCA detailing an interview with Anthony William Atzenhoffer Jr., conducted by Investigator Robert Buras on October 16, 1978. Atzenhoffer discussed his tenure in the Civil Air Patrol Cadets at Moisant Squadron from 1954 to 1957, where he was a platoon sergeant. He recalled Lee Harvey Oswald's name from roll calls but noted no significant interactions. The interview also covered encounters with David Ferrie and Ed Voebel, including social events within the CAPC. The report concluded without recommending any follow-up actions.
key_findings: Anthony William Atzenhoffer Jr. served as a platoon sergeant in the Civil Air Patrol Cadets at Moisant Squadron from 1954 to 1957.
Atzenhoffer recalled Lee Harvey Oswald's name from roll calls but had no significant interactions with him.
He mentioned taking his first plane flight with David Ferrie and attending a social party where Ferrie was present.
Atzenhoffer remembered Ed Voebel as someone Oswald was close to during CAPC meetings.
The report indicates no further action was recommended based on the interview.
